speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: SCENE V. Another part of the field.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: The trumpets sound. Enter KING HENRY IV, PRINCE  HENRY, LORD JOHN LANCASTER, EARL OF WESTMORELAND, with WORCESTER and VERNON prisoners

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Thus ever did rebellion find rebuke.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Ill-spirited Worcester! did not we send grace,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Pardon and terms of love to all of you?

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And wouldst thou turn our offers contrary?

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Misuse the tenor of thy kinsman's trust?

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Three knights upon our party slain to-day,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: A noble earl and many a creature else

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Had been alive this hour,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: If like a Christian thou hadst truly borne

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Betwixt our armies true intelligence.

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: What I have done my safety urged me to;

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: And I embrace this fortune patiently,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Since not to be avoided it falls on me.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Bear Worcester to the death and Vernon too:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Other offenders we will pause upon.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Exeunt WORCESTER and VERNON, guarded

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: How goes the field?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: The noble Scot, Lord Douglas, when he saw

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: The fortune of the day quite turn'd from him,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: The noble Percy slain, and all his men

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Upon the foot of fear, fled with the rest;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: And falling from a hill, he was so bruised

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: That the pursuers took him. At my tent

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: The Douglas is; and I beseech your grace

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I may dispose of him.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: With all my heart.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Then, brother John of Lancaster, to you

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: This honourable bounty shall belong:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Go to the Douglas, and deliver him

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Up to his pleasure, ransomless and free:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: His valour shown upon our crests to-day

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Hath taught us how to cherish such high deeds

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Even in the bosom of our adversaries.

speaker: LANCASTER
text_entry: I thank your grace for this high courtesy,

speaker: LANCASTER
text_entry: Which I shall give away immediately.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Then this remains, that we divide our power.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: You, son John, and my cousin Westmoreland

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Towards York shall bend you with your dearest speed,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: To meet Northumberland and the prelate Scroop,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Who, as we hear, are busily in arms:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Myself and you, son Harry, will towards Wales,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: To fight with Glendower and the Earl of March.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Rebellion in this land shall lose his sway,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Meeting the cheque of such another day:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And since this business so fair is done,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Let us not leave till all our own be won.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Exeunt
